H0.text: The beans that were soaked the least amount of time are most likely the control group in Elias's investigation of whether soaking beans in water before planting affects how the beans grow.

H1.text: The beans that were not soaked in water are the most likely control group in Elias's investigation of how soaking beans in water before planting affects bean growth.

H2.text: The beans that had the greatest mass are the control group in Elias's investigation of whether soaking beans in water before planting affects how the beans grow.

H3.text: The beans that grew the tallest would most likely be the control group in Elias's investigation of whether soaking beans in water before planting affects how the beans grow.

A4.text: the control group, which has all the same element as the experimental group, without the interventional element

A5.text: In the pure experimental design, the independent (predictor) variable is manipulated by the researcher – that is – every participant of the research is chosen randomly from the population, and each participant chosen is assigned randomly to conditions of the independent variable
